poem:
**Eulogy for Elegance**  

In the Southern light, a silhouette  
graced the world's pages, poised,  
an icon before influence. Maggie T,  
daughter of Australia,  
now framed in memory's gold.  
Her spirit threads through fabric,  
woven in textures of time.  
Before her, the runway whispers  
stories when style was an art.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Maggie Tabberer: Vogue model who became the face of Australian fashion Before Instagram influencers and reality show home renovators there was Maggie Tabberer, whose poise and urbane advice on fashion and decorating made her a household name. Known fondly as Maggie T, she has died just days before her 88th birthday. Tabberer was, quite literally, the face of Australian fashion. Photographed by Lord Snowdon in 1960, she was the first local model to appear on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
